title: Shell CEO Warns of ‘Huge Impact’ If Strait of Hormuz Blocked
content: Shell Plc, one of the biggest traders of oil and natural gas, has contingency plans in case the conflict between Israel and Iran disrupts flows from the region, warning that a potential blockage of the Strait of Hormuz could deliver a substantial shock.

title: Philippines Cuts Key Rate Again as Inflation Stays Below Target
content: The Philippine central bank lowered its key interest rate by a quarter point for the second time this year as widely expected, after inflation remained below target.

title: Hong Kong Dollar’s Swings Fuel Talk on How FX Peg May Shift
content: A fresh debate about the sustainability of Hong Kong’s decades-long currency peg has analysts ruminating on what might eventually replace it.

title: Horizons Middle East & Africa 06/19/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: What China’s Listing Frenzy in Hong Kong Means for Investors
content: Chinese companies are lining up in droves to list on the Hong Kong stock exchange, sparking a frenzy in a market that has been forsaken by investors and companies for many years.

title: Credit Specialist NorthWall Taps Into Hot Demand for Europe
content: Alternative credit investor NorthWall Capital is seeking to make the most of renewed demand for exposure to Europe, more than doubling its assets under management since the start of the year.

title: Stocks Slide on Mideast Tension, Fed’s Warning: Markets Wrap
content: Equities declined as the US weighed the potential for direct conflict with Iran, while Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned of meaningful inflation ahead.

title: Gold Drops as Fed Inflation Warning Outweighs Middle East Risks
content: Gold dropped as an inflation warning from the Federal Reserve, which raised the possibility of fewer US rate cuts, outweighed haven bids due to the situation in the Middle East.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 6/19/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Funds Load Up on Ultra-Long Bonds in India as Spreads Soar
content: India’s unexpected pivot away from interest rate cuts is pushing some local debt funds to buy ultra-long bonds.

title: Europe’s Power Market Is So Hot, Traders Are Leaving Retirement
content: After more than a decade out of the power market, 51-year-old Daken Engmann has been tempted back.

title: Campari’s Family Owner Said to Invest in Buyout Firm Bluegem
content: The controlling shareholder of distiller Davide-Campari Milano NV is close to acquiring a significant minority stake in consumer-focused private equity firm Bluegem Capital Partners, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Swiss Exports to US Collapse as Shippers Wait for Tariff Deal
content: Swiss exports to the US plunged for a second month as cross-border shippers wait for a trade deal to cushion tariffs proposed by President Donald Trump.

title: UBS Capital Boost From Swiss Reforms Is Feasible, SNB Says
content: UBS Group AG should be able to meet any new capital requirements arising from the Swiss government’s recent reform proposals without tapping shareholders or unduly curtailing investor payouts, according to the Swiss National Bank.

title: Malaysia Reserves at Three-Year High to Aid Stable Ringgit
content: Malaysia’s increasing currency reserves are bolstering its defenses against market volatility.

title: Oil Swings as Investors Watch for Trump’s Plan on Iran Conflict
content: Oil fluctuated as the market focused on whether President Donald Trump will plunge the US into the conflict between Israel and Iran.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks Drop on Building Middle East Tensions
Bloomberg: The China Show 06/19/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Japan to Propose Trimming Super-Long Bond Issuance From July
content: Japan’s finance ministry is considering trimming its issuance of super-long bonds starting in July, according to a draft of a revised bond issuance plan seen by Bloomberg.

title: GSMA's Badrinath on China's Telecom Sector Outlook
content: Vivek Badrinath, Director General at GSMA, discusses his outlook for China's mobile & telecom sector outlook, as the country adopts 5G and artificial intelligence technology in these industries to boost connectivity.  He speaks with Stephen Engle on the sidelines of Mobile World Congress Shanghai on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Robots, AI Take Over Mobile World Congress in Shanghai
content: AI, 5G and robots are in focus at the Mobile World Congress in Shanghai, Asia's largest conference for the mobile economy. Bloomberg's Chief North Asia correspondent, Stephen Engle brings us this report. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: War and Food Prices Could Heat Up Powell's Summer
content: Uncertainty has given the Fed reasons to pause rate cuts. Here are a couple of more.

title: Thai Stocks Poised for Five-Year Low on Political Upheaval
content: Thailand’s equity benchmark index fell Thursday, heading toward its lowest closing level since March 2020 after the government’s second-largest party quit the ruling coalition, piling further pressure on Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra.

title: Malaysia’s Anwar Says Trade Talks With US Have Been ‘Excellent’
content: Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said that Malaysia’s negotiations with the US to lower its tariffs on the Southeast Asian nation have been going well.

title: China’s Top Soy Sauce Maker Rises in Hong Kong Trading Debut
content: Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food Co., China’s biggest soy sauce maker, rose on its Hong Kong trading debut after its HK$10.1 billion ($1.3 billion) stock offering drew strong demand from investors.

title: Trump Tight-Lipped on Iran Plan | Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 6/19/25
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Avril Hong and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Italy’s Bank Deals Trip Over Pushback From Investors and Rome
content: For almost a year now, Italy has been at the center of a renaissance in European bank takeovers, with at least half a dozen deals proposed. So far, most are stuck in political opposition and competing investor interests.

title: China Copper Smelters Match Record as Foreign Rivals Falter
content: Chinese copper production stayed at record levels last month, despite a plunge in the fees charged by smelters, piling the pressure on operations elsewhere in the world that compete for feedstock.

title: China’s Biggest Soy Sauce Maker Rises in Hong Kong Trading Debut
content: Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food Co., China's biggest soy sauce maker, rose 3.3% on its Hong Kong trading debut on Thursday. That's after its HK$10.1 billion ($1.3 billion) stock offering drew strong demand from investors. Bloomberg's Manuel Baigorri reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Vietnamese Dong Drops to Record Low as Asian Currencies Weaken
content: The Vietnamese dong fell, dropping below a record low it touched in April, as Asian currencies declined following a report the US is preparing for a possible strike on Iran.

title: Thai Coalition on Brink of Collapse After PM’s Leaked Phone Call
content: Thailand’s government faces possible collapse after a leaked phone call triggered fresh political turmoil, with Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra confronting demands to resign and street protests following the exit of the coalition’s second-largest party.

title: Gulf States Caught off Guard by Speed of Israel’s Iran Attack
content: They spent years working toward a detente with their historical enemy. Now they’re contemplating a conflict that could jeopardize their oil infrastructure, hamper their ambitious economic plans and destabilize the region.

title: South Korea Plans $22 Billion Extra Budget as Tariffs Hit Growth
content: South Korea unveiled an extra budget worth billions of dollars, in a bid to support an economy struggling with sluggish consumption and mounting trade headwinds from Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: Swiss Exports to US Collapse as Shippers Wait for Tariff Deal
content: Swiss exports to the US plunged for a second month as cross-border shippers wait for a trade deal to cushion tariffs proposed by President Donald Trump.

title: Qatar Weighs $3.5 Billion Tourism Deal on Egypt’s North Coast
content: Qatar is in advanced talks to invest $3.5 billion in a tourism project on Egypt’s Mediterranean coast, the latest potential Gulf backing for the North African nation’s economy that’s been roiled by regional conflict.

title: Russian Ties Do Little for Iran While Boosting North Korea
content: During its war on Ukraine, Russia has leaned on North Korea for artillery shells and troops, and on Iran for drone technology. The payback for the two members of what George W. Bush once called the “Axis of Evil” has been markedly different.

title: Nippon Steel Says It Could Issue Equity to Fund US Takeover
content: Nippon Steel Corp. will consider a capital increase to fund its long-awaited $14.1 billion purchase of United States Steel Corp. and associated investment promises, the company’s vice chairman said on Thursday.

title: New Zealand Pauses Cook Islands Funding Over China Deal
content: New Zealand has paused development funding to the Cook Islands after the tiny South Pacific nation signed agreements with China without the expected level of consultation.

title: Malaysia’s Anwar Says Trade Talks With US Have Been ‘Excellent’
content: Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said that Malaysia’s negotiations with the US to lower its tariffs on the Southeast Asian nation have been going well.

title: US Orders Social Media Vetting for Student Visa Applicants
content: The US State Department has ordered a review of student visa applicants’ social media presence and told them to make their profiles public, stepping up measures to restrict foreign citizens’ entry to American campuses over national security concerns.

title: US Officials Prepare for Possible Strike on Iran in Coming Days
content: Senior US officials are preparing for the possibility of a strike on Iran in the coming days, according to people familiar with the matter, a sign that Washington is assembling the infrastructure to directly enter a conflict with Tehran.

title: Trump’s Envoy to China Calls Out Threat of Foreign Supply Chains
content: The US wants to revamp its trading relationship with China and the world by bringing many critical supply chains back onshore, the American ambassador to Beijing said.

title: Unfrozen Loans Give Arce Hope of Easing Crippling Bolivia Crisis
content: Bolivian President Luis Arce plans to use overseas loans green-lit by congress to tackle crippling fuel shortages and soaring consumer prices before he leaves office in November.

title: US Says Rwanda and Congo Will Sign Peace Agreement on June 27
content: Foreign Ministers from Rwanda and Democratic Republic of Congo will sign a peace agreement June 27 in an attempt to end conflicts between the two nations that have persisted for decades, the US State Department said Wednesday.

title: Chicago Allows Summer Curfews for Minors as Mayor Vows Veto
content: Chicago’s city council voted to give its police chief the green light to enforce temporary curfews for minors in a bid to curb violence that has typically ramped up during the summer months, prompting Mayor Brandon Johnson to vow to block the measure.

title: Trump Wraps Situation Room Meeting as Iran Plan Remains Mystery
content: President Donald Trump concluded a meeting Wednesday with top advisers as he weighed whether to plunge the US into the ongoing war between Israel and Iran, but the White House offered few clues about whether he had decided to join the offensive aimed at destroying Tehran’s nuclear program.

title: Pakistan Army Chief Discusses Israel-Iran Conflict With Trump
content: President Donald Trump met Pakistan’s army chief Wednesday in Washington as the US considers supporting Israeli airstrikes on Iran, a country with a cooperative and complex relationship with the government in Islamabad.

title: Colombian High Court Blocks Petro’s Referendum on Labor Rights
content: One of Colombia’s highest courts blocked President Gustavo Petro’s proposal to hold a referendum on boosting labor rights.

title: Trump Tells Supreme Court No Need to Rush to Consider Tariffs
content: President Donald Trump’s administration urged the US Supreme Court to turn away a request for fast-track review of his sweeping tariffs, saying the justices should give lower courts more time to weigh in.

title: Senate Republicans Float Rural Hospital Fund to Ease Impasse Over Tax Bill
content: Senate Republicans are crafting provisions to provide funding for struggling rural hospitals in order to resolve an impasse on Medicaid changes that is one issue holding up passage of President Donald Trump’s tax-cut bill.

title: Social Security Warns of 23% Benefit Cut by 2034 Without a Fix
content: The Social Security trust fund will become unable to pay scheduled benefits to retirees and the disabled as soon as 2034, new projections show — one year earlier than last year’s estimates.

title: Trump’s Iran War Talk Testing His Ties With MAGA Loyalists
content: Donald Trump’s hints that he may dispatch the US military to help Israel destroy Iran’s nuclear program has spurred a revolt from his typically faithful America First base, further dividing a party already struggling to unite around the president’s second-term agenda.

title: Trump Sees His MAGA Base Dividing Over Iran
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the rift among Trump supporters over what to do about Iran. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

content: For the full experience visit: Here's Where NYC Mayoral Candidates Stand on Key Issues

title: Czech Government Wins Confidence Vote Months Ahead of Election
content: The Czech government survived a confidence vote initiated by the opposition over a Bitcoin scandal, shouldering through the turmoil ahead of a parliamentary election scheduled for October.

title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Reprieve
content: President Donald Trump plans to extend for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.

title: Kirchner Begins Her House Arrest: ‘Can I Go Out to My Balcony or Not?’
content: Former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner started her first full day of house arrest wondering what she can actually do at her home in Argentina’s capital for the next six years.

title: Why Oil Prices Are Decoupling From Geopolitical Threats
content: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss how Israel’s surprise attack on Iran and the resulting war aren’t having the expected effects on energy markets.

title: Trump Urges SALT Deal as Lawler Stands Firm on $40,000 Cap
content: President Donald Trump expressed optimism that lawmakers could reach a compromise on the state and local tax deduction — a sticking point in his “One Big Beautiful Bill” — even as a key SALT advocate insisted a deal had already been reached.

title: Trump Targets Fertilizer Plant to Tighten Screws on Maduro
content: One of Venezuela’s most valuable overseas assets is set to lose a license that allows it to operate in Colombia, amid a US attack on the finances of the Nicolas Maduro regime.

title: BOE Rate Decision Day: What to Expect
content: The Bank of England is expected to keep interest rates on hold at 4.25% and signal it is sticking with its one-cut-every-other-meeting approach as officials try to strike a balance between elevated inflation, higher oil price and a slowing economy. Bloomberg’s Morwenna Coniam reports.

title: Why Is Hezbollah Staying Out of the Iran-Israel War?
content: Tehran spent decades funding and arming Islamist groups in countries like Iraq, Yemen and Israel’s northern neighbor Lebanon — all of them committed to bringing about the Jewish state’s demise. Hezbollah was once one of the most formidable non-state forces in the world, yet since Israel started its attack on Iran late last week, the group has been absent from the unfolding conflict. Bloomberg’s Dana Khraiche breaks down the situation.

content: Good morning. US officials are said to be preparing for a possible strike on Iran. The Federal Reserve signals higher prices are coming. And UBS says the world added more than 684,000 new millionaires last year. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: US Prepares for Possible Strike on Iran
content: Senior US officials are preparing for the possibility of a strike on Iran in the coming days, according to people familiar with the matter. President Donald Trump has for days publicly mused about calling for such a strike, which has been engaged in a war with Israel for nearly a week. Bloomberg’s Paul Wallace breaks down the situation.

content: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, Meghan O'Sullivan, Director at Harvard's Belfer Center, shares her thoughts on whether or not the United States plans on getting involved in the escalation between Israel and Iran. Senator Elizabeth Warren (D) Massachusetts shares her thoughts on President Trump and the Federal Reserve stating the President has created 'self inflicting problems' to the US economy. title: Trump Weighs War Intervention in Iran
content: Meghan O'Sullivan, Director at Harvard's Belfer Center, shares her thoughts on whether or not the United States plans on getting involved in the escalation between Israel and Iran, and what US involvement could potentially look like. She speaks with Joe Mathieu and Tyler Kendall on the late edition of Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Cornell Warns of Job Losses, Austerity After Trump Funding Cuts
content: Cornell University warned of job cuts and “financial austerity in all areas” as it steps up efforts to address budget shortfalls stemming from US funding cuts under President Donald Trump.

title: Vodafone Appoints Microsoft Executive Pilar López as CFO
content: Vodafone Group Plc has appointed Pilar López as its new chief financial officer following the departure of Luka Mucic, who announced he was leaving last month.

title: SpaceX’s Starship Explodes on Test Stand in Yet Another Setback
content: A SpaceX Starship exploded on a test stand in Texas, one more setback to Elon Musk’s ambitions to operate return trips to Mars.

title: Malaysia Files Suit Against Telegram Channels Over Content
content: Malaysia’s communications regulator has filed a civil suit against two Telegram channels over content that it deemed harmful.

title: Uber Warns Hong Kong Drivers and Riders of Possible New Curbs
content: Uber Technologies Inc. is emailing Hong Kong users to raise concerns about rules the city is formulating, warning the government could cap the number of drivers or vehicles allowed on the platform.

title: LG Electronics Is Said to Consider Resuming IPO of Indian Unit
content: LG Electronics Inc. is considering reviving an initial public offering of its Indian unit as soon as September, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Alibaba Cloud to Start Second Data Center in South Korea by June
content: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. will open a second data center in South Korea by the end of June, accelerating its multibillion-dollar bet on artificial intelligence and cloud computing.

title: Alibaba-Backed ‘AI Dragon’ MiniMax Plans Hong Kong IPO
content: MiniMax is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong, people familiar with the situation said, in what would be a landmark industry debut for a Chinese AI startup valued at about $3 billion.

title: Amazon Orders Employees to Relocate to Seattle and Other Hubs
content: Amazon.com Inc. is ordering some corporate employees to move closer to their managers and teams, roiling a workforce already worried about job cuts and warnings from the top that artificial intelligence will shrink their ranks in the coming years.

title: Chipmaker Wolfspeed Nears Bankruptcy Deal With Lenders Including Apollo
content: Struggling chipmaker Wolfspeed Inc. will be taken over by creditors including Apollo Global Management Inc. under a proposal that would put it into bankruptcy just long enough to slash billions of dollars in debt, according to people familiar with the plan.

title: Meta Approaches OpenAI Staff, David Sacks on Genius Act | Bloomberg Tech 6/18/2025
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the impact of the stablecoin legislation that passed the Senate with White House AI and Crypto Czar David Sacks. Plus, Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski talks about the startup's super-app ambitions, Zoox CEO Aicha Evans joins from the company’s new facility to mass-produce robotaxis, and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman claims Meta is offering bonuses as high as $100 million to OpenAI staffers to jump ships. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Blackstone Snaps Up Stakes in Office Buildings Leased by Meta
content: Blackstone Inc.’s real estate business purchased stakes in two office properties in Bellevue, Washington, that are leased by Meta Platforms Inc.

title: Trump Again Pushes TikTok Sale Deadline With 90-Day Reprieve
content: President Donald Trump plans to extend for a third time the deadline for Chinese company ByteDance Ltd. to divest the American operations of TikTok, allowing the social media app to keep running in the US while negotiations proceed.

title: Eutelsat to Supply French Military Satellite Service in Deal
content: Satellite operator Eutelsat SA struck a 10-year deal with the French government on Wednesday to provide service for the country’s military.

title: Trump Is Delaying the US TikTok Ban Again. What’s Next?
content: One of the first actions President Donald Trump took at the outset of his second presidency was granting a stay of execution for TikTok. Two and a half months later, he granted a second, and on June 18, he promised a third.

title: Trump Adviser David Sacks Says China Adept at Evading Chip Curbs
content: White House crypto and artificial intelligence czar David Sacks warned that China has grown adept at evading US export controls and is at most two years behind American semiconductor design capabilities.

title: Microsoft Planning Thousands More Job Cuts Aimed at Salespeople
content: Microsoft Corp. is planning to ax thousands of jobs, particularly in sales, as part of the company’s latest move to trim its workforce amid heavy spending on artificial intelligence.

title: Scale AI Rivals See Customer Demand Surge After Meta Investment
content: Alex Ratner was trying to get in a few hours of work after putting his kids to bed when news broke that Meta Platforms Inc. planned to invest billions of dollars in data-labeling startup Scale AI. Within minutes, Ratner, who runs a rival company called Snorkel AI, began fielding calls from his board about the chance to pick up clients worried about Scale’s independence.

title: SoftBank-Backed Startup Harmed by YouTube Shift to Short Video
content: Just a couple years ago, Spotter Inc. was one of the most valuable startups in the booming business of YouTube celebrity. The company, which boasted a new way for social media stars to fund their operations, fronted millions of dollars to creators like MrBeast and Dude Perfect in exchange for a share of the revenue their videos generated.

title: Iranian, Israeli Hacking Groups Spent Years Sparring Online
content: American officials have offered a reward for a notorious Iranian hacking group, as the conflict between Iran and Israel is spilling into the digital world.

title: Amazon’s Zoox Opens Robotaxi Production Site in California
content: Amazon.com Inc.’s Zoox autonomous driving unit opened a robotaxi production facility in California in the latest move by a deep-pocketed tech company to expand the nascent industry.

title: Waymo Applies for NYC Testing Permit, Sending Uber and Lyft Shares Lower
content: Alphabet Inc.’s Waymo has applied for a permit to test its robotaxis in New York City, underscoring its intent to operate in one of the largest ride-hailing markets in the US despite an absence of local regulations supporting commercially operated autonomous vehicles.

title: Nvidia Joins $650 Million Funding for Gates-Backed Nuke Firm
content: TerraPower LLC, a nuclear startup founded by billionaire Bill Gates, raised $650 million to help continue development of an advanced reactor project under construction in Wyoming.

title: Intel Brings in New Engineering Leaders to Help AI Comeback
content: Intel Corp. named new engineering leadership as part of a turnaround effort under Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan, tapping veterans of Cadence Design Systems Inc., Apple Inc. and Google.

title: Justices Back Temporary Texas Nuclear Waste Storage Site
content: The US Supreme Court left intact a federal plan to store as much as 40,000 tons of highly radioactive waste at a temporary site in west Texas over the objections of local landowners and oil and gas operators.

title: OpenAI Is Phasing Out Scale AI Work Following Startup’s Meta Deal
content: OpenAI is phasing out the work it does with data-labeling startup Scale AI, cutting ties with the company days after Meta Platforms Inc. invested billions of dollars in it and hired its founder.

title: Lab-Grown Meat Soon on Australia’s Menus After Approval
content: Australia has approved the sale of slaughter-free Japanese quail, becoming only the third country in the world to permit the sale of meat cultivated from animal cells.

title: Broadcom’s 340% Rally Has Wall Street Debating If It's Magnificent Seven Material
content: For more than two years, conversations about the biggest, most important technology companies have revolved around the same seven stocks. Now, some on Wall Street are making the case that Broadcom Inc. should be part of that discussion.

title: Xreal’s One Pro Are a Stopgap Ahead of True AR Smart Glasses
content: Review: The company’s latest augmented-reality glasses excel as an external display for phones, PCs and gaming devices.

title: Texas Instruments Touts Plans to Invest $60 Billion in the US
content: Texas Instruments Inc. touted plans to spend more than $60 billion on semiconductor plants in the US, making it the latest chipmaker to promote its domestic manufacturing ambitions as the Trump administration urges investments and threatens to upend the sector with tariffs.

title: Tencent-Backed MiniMax Releasing AI Tools to Take On Manus
content: Chinese upstart MiniMax is slated to roll out a pair of AI products that autonomously perform tasks on behalf of users, upping its game in the realm of agentic AI against the likes of OpenAI and Manus.

title: South Korea Plans $22 Billion Extra Budget as Tariffs Hit Growth
content: South Korea unveiled an extra budget worth billions of dollars, in a bid to support an economy struggling with sluggish consumption and mounting trade headwinds from Donald Trump’s tariffs.

title: Australia’s Beef Industry Can Wait Out Trump Tariffs, Envoy Says
content: Australia should maintain its cautious approach to the Trump administration’s “reciprocal” tariffs, despite the potential impact on the beef industry which makes up a major part of the nation’s agricultural exports to the US, according to a government trade envoy.

title: Swiss Exports to US Collapse as Shippers Wait for Tariff Deal
content: Swiss exports to the US plunged for a second month as cross-border shippers wait for a trade deal to cushion tariffs proposed by President Donald Trump.

content: Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said that Malaysia’s negotiations with the US to lower its tariffs on the Southeast Asian nation have been going well.

title: Even a Reversal May Not Bring the Ultra-Rich Back
content: The budget crisis left by the Tories and Labour’s policy prescriptions have so-called non-doms saying goodbye to Britain.

title: Biggest Free Food Program Hobbled by India’s Dated Census Data
content: The government relies on old figures to shape budgets and policies.

title: Australia’s Surprising Job Losses Bolster Case for Rate Cuts
content: Australia’s economy surprisingly shed jobs in May, though unemployment held steady as fewer people sought work, suggesting a slight loosening of the labor market and bolstering the case for the Reserve Bank to reduce interest rates further.

title: Philippine Central Bank Chief Calls Peso Intervention Futile
content: The Philippines will tolerate the slide in its currency to a 10-week low, with the central bank governor saying intervention won’t be effective in the face of global risk aversion.

title: Trump’s Envoy to China Calls Out Threat of Foreign Supply Chains
content: The US wants to revamp its trading relationship with China and the world by bringing many critical supply chains back onshore, the American ambassador to Beijing said.

content: Bolivian President Luis Arce plans to use overseas loans green-lit by congress to tackle crippling fuel shortages and soaring consumer prices before he leaves office in November.

content: On this week’s Australia Podcast: Rebecca Jones talks to reporter Ben Westcott about the potential fallout from the Pentagon’s review of the Aukus pact.

title: Taiwan Seen Holding Benchmark Rate Due to Tariff Uncertainty
content: Taiwan is likely to hold its benchmark interest rate for the fifth straight quarter as it considers worries about tariffs, the economy and inflation – though a surge in the local currency provides some incentive for a cut.

title: New Zealand’s Economic Recovery Gathers Pace as Exports Jump
content: New Zealand’s economic recovery from a 2024 recession gathered pace in the first quarter as the central bank lowered interest rates and exports surged.

title: Brazil Lifts Interest Rate to 15% as Robust Economy Fuels Inflation
content: Brazil’s central bank raised its key interest rate by a quarter-point and signaled borrowing costs will likely remain steady for a long period as board members gauge the impact of tight policy on inflation and activity.

title: Irish Central Bank Cuts Economic Forecast Again on Heightened Uncertainty
content: Ireland’s central bank revised down its economic outlook for the second time in a row as heightened geopolitical uncertainty weighs on the small, open economy.

title: Gen Z Drives Britain’s Consumer Confidence to Highest This Year
content: UK consumer confidence jumped to its highest level this year, boosted by rising optimism among Generation Z after the latest increase in the minimum wage.

title: BOE Set to Hold Rates With Oil Posing New Threat
content: The Bank of England is expected to keep interest rates at 4.25% on Thursday and signal it is sticking with its one-cut-every-other-meeting approach as officials try to strike a balance between elevated inflation, higher oil prices and a slowing economy.

title: Fed’s Powell Says Rate Path Unclear But Tariff Impact Is Coming
content: There are a lot of unknowns about the outlook for the economy and interest rates, but Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled at least one thing seems certain: Higher prices are coming.

title: US Bonds Rally Stalls as Powell Endorses a Patient Fed Approach
content: The Treasury market stalled after Federal Reserve officials indicated they’re still on course to deliver two interest-rate reductions this year, despite the risk of resurgent inflation.

title: Fed Officials Hold Rates Again, Still See Two Cuts by Year End
content: Federal Reserve officials continued to pencil in two interest-rate cuts in 2025, though new projections showed a growing divide among policymakers over the trajectory for borrowing costs as tariffs make their way through the US economy.

title: Czech Government Wins Confidence Vote Months Ahead of Election
content: The Czech government survived a confidence vote initiated by the opposition over a Bitcoin scandal, shouldering through the turmoil ahead of a parliamentary election scheduled for October.

title: Brazil Braces for Thriller Rate Decision as Bank Calls Shift
content: On the eve of Brazil’s interest rate decision this week, XP’s Chief Economist Caio Megale agonized over data and policymaker speeches before switching his forecast to a hold from a quarter-point rise. Poring over the same details, ASA economist Leonardo Costa went the opposite way, ditching his bet on steady borrowing costs and calling for a hike instead.

title: Why Oil Prices Are Decoupling From Geopolitical Threats
content: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss how Israel’s surprise attack on Iran and the resulting war aren’t having the expected effects on energy markets.

title: Macklem Warns of Firmer Inflation, Uncertainty About Impact of Tariffs
content: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem reiterated that he sees inflation running hotter than expected, while saying employment appears to be holding up outside of trade-intensive sectors.

title: Powell Won’t Say If He’ll Stay On as Fed Chair After Term Ends
content: Chairman of the US Federal Reserve Jerome Powell speaks during a news conference following an FOMC meeting in Washington, DC, on June 18.

title: Big Spenders Have Banks Raising Prices, Perks on Premium Cards
content: Sweeter benefits — and higher fees — on travel cards from Chase and Amex reflect a new US economic reality, with the richest households driving half of all consumer spending.

title: IMF Says Zimbabwe’s Economy Has Made ‘Significant Progress’
content: The International Monetary Fund said Zimbabwe’s economic progress represents a “regime change,” but declined to say if or when the Washington-based lender would grant it a staff-monitored program.

title: ECB’s Panetta Says Economic Outlook Faces Substantial Risks
content: The euro-zone’s economic prospects face “substantial” dangers that officials are struggling to assess, according to European Central Bank Governing Council member Fabio Panetta.

title: Modi Disputes Trump’s Version of India-Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi disputed President Donald Trump’s claims that trade deals were used to clinch a recent ceasefire with Pakistan, the latest sign of possible strain in the relationship between New Delhi and Washington.

title: Vodafone Appoints Microsoft Executive Pilar López as CFO
content: Vodafone Group Plc has appointed Pilar López as its new chief financial officer following the departure of Luka Mucic, who announced he was leaving last month.

title: Nestlé Picks Ex-Inditex Boss to Succeed Bulcke as Chairman
content: Nestlé SA extended its leadership overhaul by proposing longtime Inditex SA executive Pablo Isla as its next chairman to succeed company veteran Paul Bulcke when he retires next year.

title: Swiss Watch Exports Slump in May as US Tariffs Shake Market
content: Swiss watch exports dropped by almost 10% in May led by a slump in shipments to the US, reversing the previous month’s surge when manufacturers were trying to get ahead of a looming trade war.

title: Barclays Said to Be Among Firms Interested in Buying TSB
content: Banco Sabadell SA’s British unit TSB is attracting initial interest from potential buyers including Barclays Plc and Banco Santander SA, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Credit Specialist NorthWall Taps Into Hot Demand for Europe
content: Alternative credit investor NorthWall Capital is seeking to make the most of renewed demand for exposure to Europe, more than doubling its assets under management since the start of the year.

title: Americana Eyes Adding Five Guys Operator to Gulf Franchise Empire
content: Americana Restaurants International Plc is exploring a deal to buy the Middle Eastern operator of brands including Five Guys and Cinnabon, according to people familiar with the matter, in a move that would further expand its network of international food franchises.

title: A $1.4 Billion Project Taps the Housing Boom in Dubai’s Neighbor Sharjah
content: A firm backed by members of Sharjah’s ruling family is entering the real estate market with a 5 billion dirham ($1.4 billion) housing project, seeking to tap into growing demand in Dubai’s northern neighbor.

title: Big Pay Packages Spark Growing Dissent Among UK Shareholders
content: Shareholder dissent over executive pay at British companies is rising just as firms seek to bolster pay packages to remain internationally competitive.

title: UBS Capital Boost From Swiss Reforms Is Feasible, SNB Says
content: UBS Group AG should be able to meet any new capital requirements arising from the Swiss government’s recent reform proposals without tapping shareholders or unduly curtailing investor payouts, according to the Swiss National Bank.

title: Nippon Steel Says It Could Issue Equity to Fund US Takeover
content: Nippon Steel Corp. will consider a capital increase to fund its long-awaited $14.1 billion purchase of United States Steel Corp. and associated investment promises, the company’s vice chairman said on Thursday.

title: China’s Top Soy Sauce Maker Rises in Hong Kong Trading Debut
content: Foshan Haitian Flavouring & Food Co., China’s biggest soy sauce maker, rose on its Hong Kong trading debut after its HK$10.1 billion ($1.3 billion) stock offering drew strong demand from investors.

title: Auto Tariffs Seen Hiking Car Prices by Nearly $2,000 Per Vehicle
content: Car buyers will bear the brunt of the $30 billion cost of President Donald Trump’s tariffs, driving up already high US auto prices by almost $2,000 per vehicle, according to consultant AlixPartners.

title: RFK Jr.’s New Panel Tackles Vaccine Ingredients, Kids’ Shots
content: Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s plan for America’s vaccines is coming into focus, with his revamped immunization advisory panel set to discuss the use of measles shots in kids next week and vote on an ingredient that’s been wrongly linked to autism.

title: Italy’s Bank Deals Trip Over Pushback From Investors and Rome
content: For almost a year now, Italy has been at the center of a renaissance in European bank takeovers, with at least half a dozen deals proposed. So far, most are stuck in political opposition and competing investor interests.

title: China Copper Smelters Match Record as Foreign Rivals Falter
content: Chinese copper production stayed at record levels last month, despite a plunge in the fees charged by smelters, piling the pressure on operations elsewhere in the world that compete for feedstock.

title: Massive Overcapacity Threatens to Prolong China’s Car Price War
content: China’s long-running auto price war is overshadowing a deeper problem for the nation’s car industry: persistent overcapacity. Despite a slight uptick in recent years, more than half of production capacity lay idle in 2024.

title: CDC Warns of Listeria Outbreak Linked to Chicken Alfredo Meals
content: People in 13 US states have fallen ill with the same listeria strain linked to ready-to-eat pasta meals sold at Walmart Inc. and Kroger Co. stores, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said.

title: London Seeks More Chinese Listings as City Battles IPO Drought
content: London is seeking to attract more Chinese firms to list on its stock exchange as the city struggles with a shrinking equity market and a deal drought across Europe.

title: Erratic Weather Is Hurting Indian Firms in The Biggest Consumer Market
content: Some of India’s largest companies, already hit by a demand slump, are facing a new threat in wooing the country’s 1.4 billion consumers: unpredictable weather.

title: Morgan Stanley to Shutter Electronic Equity Market-Making Unit
content: Morgan Stanley is shuttering a unit focused on electronic market-making for US equity options, retreating from a corner of the derivatives landscape that’s grown increasingly popular with retail investors, even as trading volumes boom.

title: Non-Doms Are Trying to Sell London Homes, But No One Wants Them
content: The number of London homes for sale at £5 million ($6.8 million) or more rose to the highest on record last month, as the nation contends with the departure of wealthy foreigners looking to escape tax hikes.

title: Families of 737 Crash Victims Urge Rejection of Boeing Deal
content: Family members of people killed in two fatal crashes of Boeing Co.’s 737 Max jets urged a federal judge to reject a proposed deal the company reached with US prosecutors that would allow the planemaker to avoid a criminal charge.

title: Billionaire Mark Walter to Buy LA Lakers From Buss Family
content: The Los Angeles Lakers, the storied National Basketball Association franchise that’s won 17 championships, second only to the Boston Celtics, will be sold at a record $10 billion valuation, according to people familiar with the discussions.

title: NTSB Warns About Boeing 737 Max Engine Issue That Could Lead to Smoke in Cabin
content: US safety investigators called for urgent action to be taken in response to an engine issue on Boeing Co. 737 Max aircraft that can lead to smoke in the cockpit or cabin.

title: UAW President Retaliated Against Union Officer in Funds Feud
content: United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain retaliated against one of his own top lieutenants and said he would “slit” the throats of opposition within the union, according to a report by a court-appointed monitor assigned to watch the union’s governance after years of corruption.

title: US Plans to Ease Capital Rule Limiting Banks Treasury Trades
content: The top US bank regulators plan to reduce a key capital buffer by up to 1.5 percentage points for the biggest lenders after concerns that it constrained their trading in the $29 trillion Treasuries market.

title: Jefferies Sues Regional Bank Over Alleged Water Machine Scam
content: A Jefferies Financial Group hedge fund widened its legal fight to recover more than $100 million that its former portfolio manager invested in an alleged fraud scheme involving water vending machines.

title: Billionaire Arnault Grapples With Biggest Slump in LVMH History
content: The luxury goods maker is reeling from a sharp downturn in the €364 billion industry — and questions about succession are growing louder.

title: US Plans Texas Facility to Stop Flesh-Eating Cattle Pest
content: The US Department of Agriculture announced a plan to open an $8.5 million facility in South Texas to combat the spread of the New World screwworm, a flesh-eating bug that is deadly to cattle.

title: Mutual Fund Giant Wellington Looks to Break Into Business of Buying, Selling PE Stakes
content: Wellington Management Co., which is best-known for traditional stockpicking funds, is plotting a move into the fast-growing business of buying and selling private equity stakes.

title: Fintech Funding Holds Strong As Airwallex Lands $300M

title: Proofpoint To Buy Hornetsecurity For Around $1B

title: Venture Capital’s Second(ary) Chance

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: AI Autonomous Agents Are Top 2025 Trend For Seed Investment

title: What Seed Trends Say About The Future: Live Long, Recycle And Launch More Satellites

title: A Deep Dive Into The Leading Investors In Unicorns Minted Since 2023
content: Since 2023, 259 new unicorns have joined The Crunchbase Unicorn Board, adding $605 billion in total value and altogether raising $130 billion, Crunchbase data shows. We take a look at who's leading new investments.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.
